intro: Pouteria multiflora var. quadrifida, commonly known as the four-flowered soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit, similar to the soursop, is edible and has a sweet, aromatic flavor. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit.
